definition: variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: The bus driver chews his sandwich and watches us in the overhead mirror.
sentences.chinese: 司机一边从后视镜里看戏一边嚼着三明治。

sentences.english: Just before pulling out of the parking spot, check your mirrors and your blind spot.
sentences.chinese: 驶出停车区前，查看你的后视镜及盲点。

sentences.english: Check your rear-view mirror before you drive away.
sentences.chinese: 开走之前先看看后视镜。

sentences.english: Heated exterior mirrors, electrically adjustable, aspherical.
sentences.chinese: 加热式外后视镜，可电动调节。

sentences.english: Always focus on the front windshield and not the rearview mirror.
sentences.chinese: 专心看车前的挡风玻璃，别看后视镜。

sentences.english: A minute later I spotted him in my rearview mirror.
sentences.chinese: 一分钟以后，我从后视镜里发现了他。

sentences.english: For them, rear view mirrors are useful for adding perfect makeup retouches.
sentences.chinese: 对于女士们来说，后视镜在补妆的时候用处更大一些。

sentences.english: I looked in my mirror and saw a car flying like a bat out of hell.
sentences.chinese: 我看向后视镜，看到一辆车风驰电掣的飞驰而来。

sentences.english: I could see Mike looking at me in the rearview mirror .
sentences.chinese: 我能看见麦克正从后视镜里望着我。

sentences.english: Install trim panel for mirror attachment point finisher.
sentences.chinese: 安装后视镜连接点修整器的装饰板。

sentences.english: The mo to rist saw in his driving mirror that a police car was following him.
sentences.chinese: 那位驾车人从他的后视镜里看到一辆警车正跟着他。

sentences.english: Many leaders set goals by looking in the rearview mirror.
sentences.chinese: 许多领导者都是通过看后视镜的方式来设定目标的。

sentences.english: Why does Ford look so much better in the rearview mirror?
sentences.chinese: 为什么福特总统从历史的后视镜里看起来要好得多呢？

sentences.english: I quietly reached over and shut off the meter.
sentences.chinese: 我静静的把后视镜移开，避免和她的目光接触。

sentences.english: Its adjustable mirrors make it easy to change coverage patterns.
sentences.chinese: 它的可调后视镜使它容易改变可达范围。

sentences.english: One student saw no reason to check the rearview or side mirrors.
sentences.chinese: 还有学员认为后视镜或者侧视镜都是多余的汽车组件。

definition: mirror showing a view to one's rear (including rearview mirror, side-view mirror, baby view mirror etc)
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
reflector (typically concave, as in a torch)/mirror (typically plane or convex)
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
